Reviews.Title: “The best of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: modernegirl
Reviews.Content: After a friend recommended Fusion Suites we decided to stay. We requested the Grand Suite which lived up to the name. The room was decorated nicely with a beautiful Chandelier, comfortable seating area and clean and spacious bathroom. The best part of Fusion Suites are the owners, Alex and Sharmila. Sharmila's homemade breakfast was a welcoming touch not to mention delicious and the perfect start to our days spent exploring the city. A beautiful place to stay run by a wonderful couple. We wouldn't want to stay anywhere else on our next visit to Amsterdam. We visited in May 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: TKB001
Reviews.Content: Great B&B in the posh area of Amsterdam. All the main attractions are easy to get to, service is great and room huge and deluxe. Bathroom is also very nice and the beds are comfy. There is also internet in the rooms and the night rest is great as the blinds fully close and you can make the rooms really dark. Unfortunately we didn't get to try the breakfast. Fusion suites, thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome B&B”
Reviews.Author: Kika25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusion Suites for 5 days in July 2011. This place is the best in Amsterdam, we traveled with 3 children and Suite 1 was of great size for the 5 of us. Alex and Sharmila made us feel as if we were at home, we couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “This Is What Every B&B Should Be”
Reviews.Author: HenryGreenHills
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were planning to end our trip with a stop in Amsterdam before returning home.. Based on previous reviews from Trip Advisor we decided on Fusion Suites. We were not disappointed. First about the owners: they made us feel welcome and comfortable from the moment we stepped inside. We declined the upgrade offered as we wanted the large bathroom in Suite No. 4. Alex and Sharmila were accommodating, very knowledgeable about everything Amsterdam (from convenient restaurants to using public transportation), and non-intrusive as well. All the qualities that helped to make our vacation a memorable one. Our Suite had every amenity and comfort we could want. Breakfast, as all previous guests have stated, was top notch. Having breakfast in the lovely, large, well-appointed kitchen was the perfect start to our day.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in Amsterdam @ Fusion Suites”
Reviews.Author: GlobalFive
Reviews.Content: Fusion Suites is superbly located near prominent attractions. The accommodations are wonderful. We rented two spacious and comfortable rooms for our family. The breakfast was outstanding. The host are knowledgeable and most helpful. We highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent expirience”
Reviews.Author: Snaiks
Reviews.Content: We reserved the hotel for our honeymoon about 1 month prior. We arrived at the hotel and we where being expected. As there are only 4 rooms, it was really quiet, and never saw other guests. At check in we where asked at what time we would like breakfast to be served, as they cater different times for the rooms. We where then showed to our room 1 which i have read its the biggest, and deffinetly shows. Has a 4 post bed, a closet with drawers, a closet to hang stuff, an ironing machine, a full living room with ipod connections lcd tv, expresso machine,a desk with a computer and free wifi. Overall we loved the room as it had lots of space and light. The decorations is also lovely. The bathroom which is the only thing we could complain, is because the tub door doesnt close all the way. Another thing that would be great would be a heater for the bathroom. Thats the only thing we would change. The next morning we went for breakfast at 830 AM. Simply delicious, since we woke up we where smelling the crepes being cooked, at the breakfast there was fresh orange juice, yogurt, 3 choices of cereal, brie cheese, ham, bacon, a fresh fruit plate, coffe or tea, frsh cooked crepes, a basket of bread with croissants and other choices. We where also asked iif we wanted eggs but we passed as it was going to be a lot of food. As we had breakfast what we decided what we where doing from the many tour books thye have at the lobby, the hotel is located really centrally as its closed to the museums, squares, and other attractions, if youre not into walking, stop 7 of the hop on/off bus is 2 blocks away. Hope this helps as TA previous reviewers helped us. Deffinetly the #1 hotel in amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Excellent B & B in a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Steens2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this delightful B & B for 2 nights last August. It is owned and run by a lovely couple who provide wonderful, friendly service and an extraordinary breakfast. The room was beautiful, sunny and clean, and we were made to feel at home at all times. We look forward to staying there again on our next visit to lovely Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: GuddaSig
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at Fusion Suites for five days in October. The room was beautiful, the house is gorgeous, the location excellent and the neighborhood nice. The couple who own Fusion Suites are super nice, and obviously take great care in their guests' comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay and feel like home!!”
Reviews.Author: Gary60878
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms, good breakfast, all necessary amenities and, of course, friendly hosts made us feel at home. We were treated like family even before we arrived. Alex and Sharmila made travelling to Amsterdam with three children seamless for us. They were flexible and courteous and provided us with many suggestions on places to go and things to.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: GGrig
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, located in a quiet neighborhood near Vondelpark, Fusion Suites is a perfect place to stay in Amsterdam. Clean, spacious rooms, good breakfast, all necessary amenities and, of course, friendly hosts made us feel at home. There are many places to visit in this world, but if we ever go to Amsterdam again, Fusion Suites will be the first on the list to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely to be back ...”
Reviews.Author: 3DJs_dad
Reviews.Content: Our wonderful hosts Alex and Sharmila were welcoming us like long lost friends when we returned after a two year gap since our last stay. We are a family of four and are on a business / leisure trip to Amsterdam from our base in Houston, Texas. We had booked half the hotel by making reservations for suites 1 and 2 on the third floor. Ideal for our kids and ideal for us. The ambiance of the very spacious suites remains on of the big selling points. Sharmila and Alex cater to our every wish or desire, nothing is too much trouble, really special. This truly feels like our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!We will definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: travelmore05
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Fusion Suites from June 30th 2011 to July 10th 2011. We were treated like family even before we arrived. Alex and Sharmila made travelling to Amsterdam with three children seamless for us. They were flexible and courteous and provided us with many suggestions on places to go and things to see that may interest both us and the children. The beds were comfortable and clean.The breakfast were excellent from the crepes to fresh fruit and yogurt. It was eagerly anticipated by all of us. the kids enjoyed taking the elevator which we made use of many times after a hard day of exploring this wonderful city and beautiful country.The hotel was located close to mostly everything from the Van Gogh Museum to the Vondel Park. It was also far enough away from the Hustle and Bustle of Downtown Amsterdam to be able relax! My family and i also appreciated the restocked fridge everyday! Thanks Alex and Sharmila we will recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, exceeded our expectation!”
Reviews.Author: PZLS
Reviews.Content: From our 1st pre-reservation email to Alex & Sharmila, owner for the past 6 years of this exclusive Bed & Breakfast, their responses and treatment was absolutely flawless. Before we arrived in Amsterdam, they helped us choose, review and book restaurants (Le Zink & Les Autres, Bussia + one more?) and they were each a true culinary experience. Our Suite (#1 on 2nd floor - see picture on website) was truly beautiful. Extremely quiet, canopy bed, antique desk, fire place, impressive curtains, great couch, flat screen tv, DVD & stereo, â€œVilleroy & Bochâ€� bathtubâ€¦each detail, every finish is top notch. The welcome flowers, wine & mini-bar (all complimentary) along with the little touches: laminated card with local phone #â€™s, their mobile # if needed after hours, computer in our room, Wi-Fi access etc... all-in-all made our stay @ Fusion by far the finest we've experience (we travel overseas 4-6 per annum). Breakfast was delicious, fresh, copious, ample choices, and both Alex & Sharmila did all they could to accommodate us. Starting the day in their kitchen, was just â€�coolâ€�. They helped us with every possible rental, question, reservation, beyond what any Four Seasonâ€™s hotel concierge ever has! Alex helped us rent a boat to spend a day on the canals - (highly recommend if you have a good sense of orientation vs. the "hop-on & off tourist boats). The hotel is located in a high-end neighborhood, within a 5 minute walk to the inner-canal area. We walked nearly everywhere (except for the 1/2 day we rented a Vespa - highly recommend as well). Just about every one we met, whether in restaurants, retail shops, in the streets, were genuinely courteous and helpful. Everyone speaks English and the varieties of places to visit, eat or dine are plentiful. Without hesitation, we both highly recommend Fusion Suites, we shall return, meanwhile weâ€™re referring our friends! Our stay was exceptional, on every level. Alex & Sharmila, you guys deserve to regain the #1 Bed & Breakfast ranking in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a luxurious small B&B you can't do better”
Reviews.Author: sfbear94108
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the fusion suites for 5 nights. The rooms are quite large and well appointed. We appreciated the stocked mini bar and the quiet. Easy walking distance to the museums. Our hosts, Alex and Shamila, couldn't have been more helpful. They arranged a personal walking tour of Amsterdam with an extremely knowledgeable guide and gave great recommendations for dinner. The breakfasts cooked to order by Shamila were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Boutique B+B with lots of Hospitality - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: blkdog2000
Reviews.Content: It was our home away from home! Located in the museum district and close to everything. Our room was large with lots of charm and ammenities. Our hosts were so warm and accomodating , took special care of us and provided us with some great recommendations on restaurants, museums and places to see. A very special place filled with some very special people. Kathy and Elliot

Reviews.Title: “Love the place a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: 2far
Reviews.Content: The hosts were wonderful! The room #1 was large and comfortable. Fusion Suites is close to the museums and on block from public transit. We will return there soon.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Member808
Reviews.Content: We spent a wonderful three days here and felt like friends by the time we left. Alex and Shamila are wonderful, warm hosts that always have the time to talk and give advice on what to see and do. As other reviewers have said the room was perfect-large, comfortable and with all the amenities you could want. Breakfast was superb. For dinner their local restaurant recommendations were spot on for us. The location is ideal as it is easy to walk everywhere yet you are out of the hectic downtown area. If we return to Amsterdam, we will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a second visit”
Reviews.Author: TrevorandMerryl
Reviews.Content: Alex and Shamila were warm, generous hosts. Our suite reflected their attention to their guests' needs, with everything that might be required available for us. With the triple-glazed windows, we were well-insulated from the cold temperatures outside, and the room required very little extra heating. The toiletries were of the highest standard and made bathing a luxurious event. Breakfast in the beautiful kitchen was as 5-star as our suite. Alex and Shamila proved to be well-informed tour guides, and made every effort to source a possible purchase, We shall definitely recommend Fusion Suites to everyone, not only for the above but also for its location.

Reviews.Title: “Class act all the way...”
Reviews.Author: WacPac
Reviews.Content: If you want the hustle and bustle/grit and grime of the city, then this place is not for you. If you want a beautiful room in a classic 19th century, 4-story townhouse in the museum district and adjacent to the Vondelpark, then don't hesitate, book now. Sharmila and Alex clearly love their role as owners/hosts and it shows. They are genuinely helpful and attentive without being intrusive. The quality, quantity and variety of the breakfasts exceeded our expectations. The rooms are elegant and spotless with tremendous attention to detail. We will not stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend get away”
Reviews.Author: Chip-and-Mim
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Amsterdam, for my husband's birthday and we were delighted to be upgraded to the Grand Suite, an absolutely gorgeous room. Being situated in the museum quarter it was an ideal location, easy to get to all the local attractions. We walked to all of these, even though it rained the whole trip but trams are another easy option. The room was spacious and very comfortable, the free mini bar was a really nice touch. Breakfast too was great, very informal, maybe an idea if this could be offered in your room, as some people may find it a bit 'cosy' if the suites are fully booked, although we had it to ourselves! We went to the Van Gogh museum on the Friday night and this had a great atmosphere, with a DJ playing in the foyer and drinks being served. Saturday night was a walk to Dam Square and a wander round the red light district, which has to be seen! Alex was a great host, very attentive but not intrusive. Although the weather wasn't kind to us we had a great stay and will definitely recommend Fusion Suites to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hampsteadbloke
Reviews.Content: This is an up-market B & B with four rooms/suites, each different. The suite which we were given - to our surprise and disappointment was not the one we had booked - it had its plus points. The bedroom /sitting room was large and well insulated from any traffic noise. It had a coffee maker, and the contents of the mini-bar, which included a bottle of wine (and if you stay long enough a bottle of champagne) were free. There was adequate storage and comfortable seating. The view was unremarkable (as we had expected). We were given a discount for our suite having been changed, but truth to tell we'd never have booked at all had we known our booking was not to be fully honoured. (With thick snow on the ground & limited taxi availability, we decided not to start looking for somewhere else to stay). The bathroom in the suite we were given was tiny with very little room for personal items, the bath itself cramped and the sound insulation between bathroom and living space inadequate. The decor of the suite was "Goth meets dominatrix" - great if you like lots of black and purple, but... The suite was cold - like the weather, but astonishingly the heating had been turned down and our first night was uncomfortable. This was not an oversight, because when we discovered and adjusted the heating controls the following day, we returned from sightseeing to find the heating turned down again! This was inexcusable - a cold room is not part of the deal, certainly not at 275 euros per night. Breakfast is served in the kitchen at a communal table - not necessarily a problem except that the table wasn't large enough. Consequently breakfast was cramped, as well as not a place for private conversation. The quality of the food and coffee was good, but the choice was limited - as is usual with a B & B. In short the price of the rooms/suites raised expectations which were not fulfilled. This was compounded in our case by our choice of suite not being honoured.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but the #2 in Amsterdam, really?”
Reviews.Author: APURKISS
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me say that this is place is charming. In essence a glorified b&b (owners live on premises, only 4 rooms, no staff). In a leafy high end neighborhood, great for museums and next to fashion shopping, just outside of the traditional Amsterdam (so you will be getting trams and taxis for town center / Anne Frank's house and many restaurants. For joggers, it is right next to the park. The room is spacious (stayed in one of the two suites). My only niggle was the bathroom was definitely dated. Breakfast is wonderful, but like all b&b's you must pick your time. However, this is a lot of money for what you get (for instance, the Chester Residence in Edinburgh is a similar concept, but rooms are twice the size, twice the services with a full service staff) - if this Euro 150, I would have no problem recommending. At over Euro 200, Alex is going to have a problem unless he keeps the rooms in tip top shape and starts thinking of more hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jakklein
Reviews.Content: My family (girls ages 9 and 12) stayed at Fusion Suites before Christmas, and had the most lovely stay. Alex and Sharmila own a small (four room) hotel, and provide the most wonderful service, and a great place to stay. Our room was huge with a large bed, sitting area, and even enough room for our kids to have separate twin beds the hosts brought into the room. The hotel is located on a quiet street near Vondelpark, extraordinarily close to the museums, and away from the crowds. We LOVED our visit!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mon1203
Reviews.Content: I can not speak highly enough of our stay at the Fusion Suites, it definately deserves all the fantastic reviews. My husband & I stayed with our 1 year old in the Grand Suite for 2 nights. The room was beautiful & had the added bonus of luxury tolietries & a free mini bar. Our host Alex was extremely helpful & very kind to our daughter. Breakfast was freshly prepared each monring in the georgous breakfast room & was excellent. It was such a great way to start to day. We could not more highly reccommend the Fusion Suites & wished we could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Fadi6
Reviews.Content: Lovely place, nice location and good hospitality. Feels like home. Well done Alex & Shamila

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Fusion Suites - You will not be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: tjrock4
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Fusion Suites. Alex and Sharmila (our hosts) exceeded our expectations in every way. From the amazing breakfast (everything you could want or imagine was served & cooked fresh just feet from our table by our gracious hosts)-- to the beautiful room (complete with claw foot tub and L'Occitane bath products)-- to the perfect location (only a block from the major museums and a few blocks from the city's center- VERY walkable)-- we couldn't have asked for anything more. Amsterdam proved to be a city that we could spend a full week in and we only allotted 3 days during our recent trip. We will definitely be back and we'll be staying at the Fusion Suites in the future. Thank you Alex and Sharmila for a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “So Happy We Chose The Fusion Suites! Thanks to TripAdvisor”
Reviews.Author: orenm
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on TA, despite using the site quite a few times. However, we received such good service that I felt personally indebted to our hosts Alex and Sharmila to write one. I picked this hotel for a trip with my wife. I couldn't find any good hotels in Amsterdam available that weekend, and had to settle for a very pricey Marriott, until I noticed the Fusion Suites on Tripadvisor. The price was the same as the Marriott, but breakfast was included, plus Alex agreed to my request for a very late checkout, which made the decision easy. In terms of value, if I compare to the alternative, it certainly was very high value. The room was beautiful (my wife was very pleasantly surprised when we arrived), very tastefully decorated, everything was clean. Some nice touches: in-room PC with Internet connection, free-to-use minibar, bottle of champagne, L'Occitane in the bathroom. Breakfast was another highlight. Sharmila prepared it so pleasantly, and we had a great time in the breakfast room. The service was so personal, we felt like we were staying with friends. The location was suitable for us, we walked to the Van Gogh museum and to Leidseplein and the canals, and traveled by tram to the rest. Bottom line, if you can afford it, go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good - compared to other 5* hotels in amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: SUMMIE
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night - normally i stay in one of the 5* hotels (amstel, pullitzer, dylan), but decided on something different. It not really a hotel, more a home from home, luxury chambre d'hote. Location: next to vondelpark, neat to: rijksmuseum, PC hooft - quiet location, tram nearby, decent on/off street parking available. Hotel: historic house, 4 suites, looks and feels extremely well kept and spotlesly clean. Woners Alex and his partner live in the house - very friendly, helpfull. Rooms: spacious, well furnished, no airco (great! ) opening windows, superb beds, bathroom with a big bathtub. - (soaps etc from l'occitane - very good) Amenities: free minibar (where do you get!!) that stocked with wine, beer, juice and softdrinks) Fast Internet - (wifi) included - there is a pc in your room (i did not try as i was on my laptop) Breakfast (included) : great - Shamila does a great job - very fresh and tasty. Room for improvement (if they want to really compete with the top hotels) - TV is from the 80's - a large flatscreen with digital cable and international programmes is the standard. Bathrobes - standard in most 5* hotels

Reviews.Title: “Undeniably fantastic accommodation, but expected more for the price”
Reviews.Author: alexmac1979
Reviews.Content: This is my first Trip Advisor review. I must admit that I feel indebted to write one, because my choice to visit 'Fusion Suites Amsterdam' was based entirely on the reviews I read on this very website. In fact, the reviews are all so very favourable, that I felt exceedingly confident my expectations would be met and exceeded. I'm sorry to say, they were not - I was extremely surprised. Make no mistake, Fusion Suites are in a fantastic and exclusive location: offering privacy and comfort, with sumptuous furnishings: the establishment truly is top class. Similarly, Alex and Sharmilla who run the place are a genuinely lovely couple, and did everything they could to make us feel welcome and to assist us where needed. They cannot be faulted on their service, which similarly, is first rate. My criticism is nothing to do with anything they did; only the price related to the amenities offered. The bottom line is for about Â£220 a night, I expected more - and could not help but feel this price tag would have would have taken us a lot further at a nice hotel. (Amenities like a pool, spa facilities, a nice bar/restaurant etc.) What you're paying for in this instance is the exclusive private location, because as a B&B it lacks the true convenience of self-catering OR the service of a hotel, and for myself and my partner, this left us feeling a little disappointed. We're not the sort of people who can generally afford to spend at this level - it was a very special occasion for our 10 year anniversary, and I'd be lying if I didn't admit we were a little underwhelmed. On arrival, we were given a free upgrade on account that it was our anniversary (a very kind sentiment), but I would have been interested to see the others. Again, we did have a couple of gripes with the room itself for this price tag: 1) Very limited English channels available, BBC News plus one or two others. The Television itself was very small and unimpressive, and was only really watchable from the sofa directly in front of it. It was physically impossible to watch the TV in bed (as my partner and I like to), as the screen was obstructed by the enormous bed frame - which we found very frustrating, and pretty poorly arranged to be honest. 2) The minibar snacks and drinks ARE included, but what's supplied is very limited. One can of coke, one fruit juice, two cans of beer and a bag of nuts is not really what I had in mind when it said "all-inclusive minibar". Similarly, I would have appreciated bottled water more than the wine that was on offer. 3) A computer with Wifi internet access was provided, but the connection was very erratic and kept disconnecting itself after a few minutes. We had to reboot the system to get it working again, every time. 4) For this money, I seriously thought we'd either have a large jacuzzi bath, or at least a power shower cubicle. It was pretty much a standard sized bath with a shower attached by a hose, and not particularly powerful. The water also was extremely inconstant in flow, seeming to chug in and out and going cold (however briefly) and regular intervals. 5) Just like the minibar, we felt what was supplied in the bathroom was particularly ungenerous - and I'd go as far as to say quite miserly! I have ALWAYS been supplied with a dressing gown wherever I have stayed abroad before, and so have never brought one with me.... at this price, I would have definitely expected them. Nope. Even though there was a bath, no bath foam/oils etc were supplied (very surprising). Not only this, but thanks to British flight regulations on liquids carried, my partner I had to make do with the three tiny vials of shampoo, conditioner & shower gel supplied between two of us for two nights, and a measly selection of towels that we had to re-use. There were plenty of things like vanity kits, nail files, shaving mirrors...just not the basic fundamental things we actually needed! 6) For this price, when only breakfast is offered, I really would have expected to have been asked what WE wanted to eat. We were simply asked what time (and were given no such choice on the second morning). The food on offer was very nice, but consisted initially of a big bowl of fruit and yoghurt on both occasions - which we felt indebted to eat when it had been freshly prepared. There were pastries, cheese, eggs, cereal, pancakes... lots and lots... almost too much to choose from, however the irony is we found ourselves craving an English breakfast, and actually went looking for one for lunch! The truth is, IF we'd been at a hotel I probably would have complained - and felt little remorse about it... but there was absolutely no way I was going to make a fuss with two such lovely and kind people who have obviously made this their family business. I'm really sorry to have any thing negative to say... I really am, and I'm certainly not trying to stand out or "go against the flow" with what every one else has had to say. But at the age of 31 and being reasonably well travelled, I've never spent more than this per night at a B&B any where in the world, and was more than a bit disappointed. I genuinely feel the place needs to be brought up to scratch in line with that price, or that price needs to be reduced. The honest truth is I would recommend Fusion Suites to a very rich friend who had money to burn... but only as an exclusive hang-out away from the masses in Amsterdam. If you're a Tourist, you may find it's a little far away from any of the real atmosphere, and lacks the real creature comforts that we slovenly Brits are often accustomed to when going abroad. I will say this however: the mattress on our bed was INCREDIBLE. I've never slept a better night's sleep in my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Daitoni
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were wanting a lovely place in Amsterdam, and boy did we find it!! This is just a wonderful place, Alex and his lovely wife ensured that all of our needs were well and truly catered for. The hotel is superb, the facilities are wonderful, the location is great, the breakfast is lovely and homely (and fortifying) and Alex is able to organize bookings at very good restaurants. It is one of the best hotels (B&B) that I have stayed at around the world. Would recommend this to anyone who wishes to experience quite refined luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Best small hotel in years”
Reviews.Author: travelwell_8
Reviews.Content: We often stay in small, boutique hotels, and think this is the best we've been in for years. The hotel is elegantly furnished, very friendly, centrally located, and can't be faulted in any way. We loved the fact that the mini-bar was included in our rate, and that the breakfast was generous and tasty. Alex and Sharmilla, the owners, are particularly helpful with information about Amsterdam and, most importantly, correct in what they tell you about the city. This was truly a hotel experience which added to our enjoyment of Amsterdam. If there's an opportunity to stay here, don't hesitate to take it. Because of its size (four rooms) you may have to do some advance planning, but it's worth it. Also, there's absolutely no intrusion on one's privacy, which can be a problem in some small places.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hinds5747
Reviews.Content: Everything good that has been said about Fusion Suites is true. It is an excellent place to stay and hosts Sharmila and Alex are superb. It was liking stay at a best friends house...but better. The location is ideal for seeing all of Amsterdam by foot if you are healthy and easy for trams if you are not (or lazy). If you want to see Amsterdam at your leisure and don't want the stuffiness and prententious of a five star hotel, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations....”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBenny
Reviews.Content: Reviews are all true. Alex and Sharmilla are fun, knowledgeable and attentive to all needs while being discreet. The room was enormous by European standards and the breakfasts were awesome, everything fresh and freshly prepared. Well-located on a quiet street near the park, but yet close to Leisdseplein, Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and the best shopping street in Amsterdam. I recommend Fusion Suites without hesitation, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was the highlight of our trip to Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: 35805Linda
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review, but our stay at Fusion Suites compels me to write one. This is the best hotel we have ever stayed in for the money - and we have travelled around the world. Alex and Sharmila are caring, charming, helpful hosts. The breakfasts that Sharmila prepares are fabulous! Our room was huge, beautifully decorated, very comfortable - we even had our own laptop. Amsterdam was chilly and rainy, so it was wonderful coming back 'home' to Fusion Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Chilled Chic”
Reviews.Author: Couplands2
Reviews.Content: A warm, friendly welcome by attentive, congenial hosts Alex and Sharmilla. A superb location and a beautiful old building. Super comfortable bed, excellent service, great value and a scrumptious breakfast. Expectations met and surpassed.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Northamptonmark
Reviews.Content: A big claim as I have only been to Amsterdam twice but I can not believe there is a better hotel. From welcome to goodbye Alex and his partner ensure your stay is a pleasure. We were blown away by the room - we went for the larger room which had a lovely 4 poster bed and a very large seating area. The bedroom and bathroom were tastefully decorated and everything was clean and tidy. The hotel has 4 rooms so book early if you are coming to Amsterdam to avoid disappointment. Breakfast was served by Alex in the beautiful kitchen - all fresh fruit salad, freshly squeezed orange juice, pastries, bacon, your choice of eggs (including poached:))' cereal etc. All included in the rate ( as was the mini bar which is a very nice gesture.) Location is great, 5 mins from the Rikjs Museum 25 mins walk from central station and therefore everything in between is close by ( which is just about everything). Internet (together with a computer) was in our room again included in the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay at Fusion Suites”
Reviews.Author: ShaiSIsrael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Fusion Suites for 3 nights at the end of August 2010, and were pleasantly surprised. Alex and Sharmilla were very welcoming and assisted us with everything. The room, although a bit confining for two adults and two small children (aged 1 and 3), was beutiful and clean. The computer with free interent in the room allowed us to plan every day in advance during the morning hours, and saved us a lot of time and running around. The breakfest, prepared by Alex and Sharmilla themselves is to die for, and can match any 5 stars hotel breakfest easily, with the addition of a personal touch and a good conversation. I recommend this hotel for everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: randyv1109
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel. Alex and Shamila were friendly and helpful and the room was great. Thanks & your lovely kitchen has inspired us to remodel our own kitchen back at home in the U.S.! Randy & Donna

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic. Worth staying here and will definately return.”
Reviews.Author: belle088
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I have just returned from a four day visit to Amsterdam. I picked Fusion Suites from the reviews and was not disappointed ( having usually gone for a top hotel ). From the moment we arrived Alex and Shamila the owners were lovely, nothing to much trouble. I chose the larger suite as we had a second bed put in for my daughter, ( which was very comfortable ) but the other rooms were still very large. From the bottle of champagne on arrival to a coffee machine, dvd player to the computor in the room I was very impressed. Each room is different and the old dutch house is beautifully restored. Lovely. If going to Amsterdam between easter and end of summer book ahead and have e-tickets these do not need to be dated and entrance is immediate. ( the queues were bad. ) Anne Franks house has to booked asap. Arrange a taxi before you go as it is alot cheaper than from the airport. Relax, wander and stop for plenty of people watching.

Reviews.Title: “You won't believe this - we didn't!”
Reviews.Author: Tony528767
Reviews.Content: The reports we read were so good we found it hard to believe.....now we are writing a report to say exactly the same ...FANTASTIC. From the moment we arrived until the minute we left nothing was too much trouble .......rooms wonderful.......breakfast an experience to treasure .. decor and overall cleanliness superb but all these things pale into insignificance compared with the way the owners (Sharmilla and Alex) treated us.......when we had a problem (nothing to do with the accommodation) they were there to help us........within minutes of arrival we were treated like 'best friends' but coupled with the respect and sincerity that even 'best friends' sometimes lack. It clearly does not matter where you come from (we are from England) because at breakfast we were joined by an American couple who spent the entire time raving about how good everything was. If you want to know the best restaurants don't trust to luck .....leave it to Sharmilla and Alex. We took their advice three times and each time we were treated to an eating extravaganza. It is very rarely that you meet such nice people but to find they also have accommodation that is so special is unusual in the extreme so we will definitely be going back sometime in the future............Tony and Carron

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place to stay while in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: thisgoesto11
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews and knew with such unanimity the place had to be great. But it even exceeded our expectations as the location was quite perfect and just far away enough to keep 5 minutes away from the madness when need be after a long day of walking. The quality of the Suites is very high and as everyone has written, Alex and Sharmilla are incredibly charming and perfect hosts as they know the city extremely well. Great rooms/great service/greal location. The only possible ding is the fact that without air conditioning, if you hit a warm spell which are likely infrequent, the room could be a tad hot if you stay in the larger ones facing the street. But we used our fan and felt 90% of the time it was fine. The replenishment of wine bottles, soft drinks and water is truly unique, and the location is fantastic to head into multiple areas of Amsterdam. Great hosts and fantastic property for couples especially!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, No Airconditioning. Hard to sleep when it's 90 in the room”
Reviews.Author: DrJamesWalzer54
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights. Very friendly owners, excellent breakfast every morning, beer and wine provided in room at no charge. Computers in room with internet service was nice. Simply could not enjoy our room on the top floor as it was way too hot and with windows open it sounded like a world cup game outside. If they get air I would go back if not....

Reviews.Title: “top of the line”
Reviews.Author: davedavison
Reviews.Content: Great location, and outstanding personal service for our stay in Amsterdam. I blew up a vital medical device and Sharmilla spent more than3 hours finally locating, ordering and accepting receipt of a replacement - this was service in keeping with the feeling that we were at home in Fusion Suites - don't miss it if you want the first class ambiance, great breakfasts and superb service; We feel we made a friend in Amsterdam - and suggest that you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Plush, perfect, almost as good as home.”
Reviews.Author: doctorbobster
Reviews.Content: Ranked #1 on TripAdvisor at the time of our booking, my hypercritical family eagerly entered the Fusion Suites following our overnight flight from Tanzania. Upon entering, we were graciously greeted by Alex, then Sharmila, the proprietors of the Fusion Suites and ushered to our room a few hours before the usual check-in time. The room, in a word, was gorgeous and equally comfortable. The bed and pillows were amongst the finest I've enjoyed while traveling. The small refrigerator was generously stocked and complimentary. The Kreurig coffee machine was a welcome touch. Sharmila's breakfast featured fruit, fresh-squeezed orange juice, yogurt and cereals, and featured her cooking to order. The suites are on a quite street and well-located. We walked everywhere. The computer in the room was a nice touch. It is more expensive than many other lodging options, but quality and comfort has a price. My next visit to this beautiful city, Fusion Suites will be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: travellerroct
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Fuaion Suites! Alex and Sharmila were wonderful. We began each morning in the kitchen with Sharmila preparing a delicious breakfast as we chatted about our plans for the day. Alex suggested several restaurants (in advance of our visit), and we thoroughly enjoyed each. Our room was spacious and lovely. We never felt "boxed in" like you can in some hotels. This was very important to us because we stayed for a full week and were back and forth to our room throughout the day. One day, we shopped at a local outdoor market and brought home bread, cheese and fruit and enjoyed a wonderful picnic in the lovely garden. We had a bottle of wine and had a lovely afternoon. We highly recommend Fusion Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic suite, exceptional hosts”
Reviews.Author: urfriendsinnj
Reviews.Content: My wife like so many others found Fusion Suites through TripAdvisor. We have traveled quite extensively and have never found such a perfect combination of superb accommodations along with two hosts, Alex and Sharmilla who are two of the nicest and genuine people we have ever met. Both my wife and I can emphatically say that the both of them really know how to make anyone feel right at home. Upon arrival they greeted us both with such warmth. I immediately picked up on how well their home was kept. This I felt would translate in how well they treat their guests, and I was right. Their home is located in one of the, if not the best neighborhood in Amsterdam. All we can say is every great review you read in TripAdvisor is true. Alex & Sharmilla are truly two wonderful and exceptional people who are operating one heck of a class operation. Anyone would be fortunate to be able to experience their hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC LITTLE GEM”
Reviews.Author: ShaunaW1
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in this little B&B. Everything was really well done and wonderful. We loved the big, beautiful room, cozy bed, big bath tub, wonderful breakfast, perfect location, and lovely owners! Having lived in Amsterdam in the past, I found this B&B to be a real gem of a find for travelers. This place is not your typical find in Amsterdam. It is worth every penny. We will always stay here on future visits. I can't recommend this place enough!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance, Warmth and Quality”
Reviews.Author: prmegson
Reviews.Content: The Fusion Suites ended our amazing 8 week Grand Tour of Europe and Alex and Sharmilla provided the most wonderful end to our holiday. The Fusion Suites are "pure class" - elegant, and everything top quality with the wow factor....and the service offered by the hosts was both warm and first class. Thank you, thank you, thank you Sharmilla and Alex - we loved the Fusion Suites and will see you next time.

Reviews.Title: “Like a dream!”
Reviews.Author: Tallereid
Reviews.Content: What a jawdropping experience we had in Amsterdam, living in this fantastic place. The room was like a dream, spacious, fresh, beautifully decorated and spending an evening there felt like home. Even before arrival, Alex gave us a warm welcoming, by email (!) and we where looking forward to meet him, allready at that time. And we were not disappointed. What a place, and the excellent service, the tasteful breakfast on our own... Alex and Sharmila, both amazing people, making our stay lovely in any way. You could feel the passion they have for running this little pearl of a place. Location was perfect for going out for shopping, a little walk in the park or having some hours filled with cultural experiences. This will be our favourite place to stay in Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in great Location”
Reviews.Author: onmrgn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusions Suites for 3 nights in May and really loved it. Alex and Sharmilla are charming and welcoming and we enjoyed the breakfasts each morning. The room is beautiful, and the location is great right near Leidseplein Square, and easy walking distance to most major Amsterdam Sites. All the good reviews on Trip advisor are true.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great find!”
Reviews.Author: dumadog
Reviews.Content: We were blown away by Sharmila and Alex, the young owners of this 4 room B&B in the Museum District of Amsterdam. Their devotion to their customers is reflected in the beauty of this delightful place. Our room and bathroom were was large, comfortable, welll appointed and maticuously cared for. Breakfasts were incredible. It is well located, only a short walk from the Reijksmuseum and the Van Gogh, nicely out of the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam, although within easy reach by foot or taxi to every thing else. We are very well traveled, and can say with great confidence that we couldn't have chosen a better place.

Reviews.Title: “any time again”
Reviews.Author: Susi11
Reviews.Content: we spend five nightÂ´s at the Fusion Suites Hotel in Amsterdam and it was a realy great experience. The room was big and clean with a comfortable bed, on the table was just waiting a bottle of champagne with strawberrys....what could you more expect for a perfect start in Amsterdam... The couple who held the hotel ( Sharmila & Alex ) are always very helpful and eager to satisfy your breakfast wishes. They are two cosmopolitan and so we could participate a lot from their evening recommedation for dinner. In this hotel you feel at home even you are away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Feel Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Star_Peepers
Reviews.Content: We recently had an extended vacation experience in the Netherlands and Belgium. During three different stays in Amsterdam we spent a total of 9 nights at Fusion Suites. There is no doubt that this property is well-located. It is within easy walking to the Museum Square, and it touches the perimeter of Vondelpark. It is close to a trolley stop, so it is easy to get around Amsterdam or get to Amsterdam Central Station to catch trains. The rooms of Fusion Suites are lovely. The decor is charming, there are fresh flowers and a very helpful Internet-connected computer in each room. Such amenities are, after all, to be expected from a high-end boutique hotel. However, there are lots of properties in this area, and we had chosen Fusion Suites primarily because many Trip Advisor reviews suggested that we would find a very friendly atmosphere coupled with gracious attention. On this aspect, we were greatly disappointed. We had planned to make many day trips, using Amsterdam as a base of operations. So we arrived full of questions about how the transportation system works, where good places to eat were located, and the like. We both immediately felt as if we were "too needy" for their tastes. We could almost feel their eyes rolling whenever we asked for "more details". This attitude from our hosts persisted during each of our three separate stays. We came to feel much awkwardness in our interactions with them, as well as regret that we had chosen this hotel. There was one additional issue that impacted our visit. The manner in which breakfast is served was confining for us. We were required to choose, on the previous day, the specific time that we wanted breakfast to be ready the next morning (as opposed to a concept such as "breakfast is served anytime between 7:30 AM to 9:30 AM"). As a consequence, our personal schedule in the mornings had no flexibility. It was not possible to have a plan such as "eat early and get on the road if the weather is favorable", or "stay in bed if one awakes to rain" and come down later. We were required to tell them in advance the exact time we would appear for breakfast, and live with our choice. The issue with breakfast times, however, was unimportant compared to the chilly atmosphere of our interactions. Bottom line: we didn't feel welcome. The next time we visit Amsterdam, we won't be returning to Fusion Suites.

Reviews.Title: “A Triumph of Small Scale”
Reviews.Author: rogerhSingapore
Reviews.Content: That a hotel with only four suites should generate so much enthusiasm at first sight seems extraordinary. In the beginning it seemed a slight let down with the thought that some of the furniture was looking a little worn and that the television and computer were definitely old model. However, after a day or so the charm and the edge over other Amsterdam hotels started to become evident. The suite was large and comfortable in contrast to the spatial economization of other central area establishments. The bathroom was pristine and beautifully kitted out. Including in the room price a full mini-bar complete with bottle of champagne and two bottles of wine is an inspirational touch other hotels don't have the courage to emulate. Everything is the personal handiwork of the two charming owners, Alex and Sharmila. Breakfast in their kitchen with friendly conversation is a delight. All in all, a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, perfect, perfect”
Reviews.Author: BCMMan
Reviews.Content: This is how a hotel should be run, friendly, welcoming, high quality, great food, superb service and it feels like home. The team running this place are absolutely wonderful, know what they are doing and I heartily recommend you stay here - if you can get a booking! The rooms were spacious and comfortable, lovely toiletries, the minibar fully stocked everyday, and wonderful handcooked breakfasts to order right in front of you....heaven!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: VirginianinEurope
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I stayed at this delightful hotel on two occasions in March. We stayed in a different Grand Suite each time. Previous reviews make Fusion 40 an obvious standout choice as the place to stay in Amsterdam. All the superlatives are described well enough that I need not repeat them. Earlier reviews made for high expectations, and our experience actually exceeded those expectations. The ambience, suites and breakfast experience greatly enhanced our trip. Alex and Shamila really set the tone for this fine establishment. They are motivated hosts who go the limit to ensure your stay is as as good as it can be. They also enjoy interacting with guests and are very interesting people. An important part of our travel experience is meeting new, interesting people--like Alex and Shamila-- and enjoying their company. They run a unique and outstanding hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Gem!”
Reviews.Author: vewz
Reviews.Content: The warmth of a friend happy to see you is the feeling you get when you enter the Fusion Suites. We traveled for three weeks to four countries staying in five star hotels along the way and not one of them compared to the experience we had at this small and charming B & B. Located in a modest neighborhood the hotel is close to the museums (and in walking distance of everything). Sharmilla and her husband Alex put love and soul into providing their guests with anything they need to make their stay comfortable and satisfying. The bathroom and bed room (room #3, 3rd floor) were large, spotless and very comfortable. It was decorated in a way that made one feel at home. The mini bar was stocked with complimentary drinks and snacks that were replenished daily. A chilled bottle of champagne was waiting for us in our room when we arrived. Free internet was also provided. This was so refreshing after traveling through Europe and having to pay for every extra drop of water along the way . Breakfast was delicious and abundant with the freshest of ingredients served.Navigating the purchase of train, museum tickets...anything we needed was provided with helpfulness and enthusiasm. You feel the pride this young couple work so diligently to offer. A job very well done and an absolute treasure!

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason this is number one...”
Reviews.Author: Alwaystruthful
Reviews.Content: OK, imagine you had a hit-list of everything your ideal break had to have: Early check-in. We turned up at 9:30am, which was really early but couldn't be helped after an obscenely early flight. Our room was ready and we were greated warmly and friendly. Late check-out. We weren't flying until late afternoon. We stayed in the room all day. At no extra charge! The rooms / suites. They are huge, are well equppied have a reasonably stocked but FREE mini-bar. Good TV, PC with free internet...You get my point. The bathroom was similar in quality too. I don't know if you'd call them suites, but would call them huge rooms. If the owners are reading, please see about having a better shower screen around the bath as the cold curtain can stick to your body. The breakfasts. There was lots of everything from croissants to eggs, to cheese to panckakes to well the list goes on. The host. Alix was charm personified, helping us with directions to advice on places to go. All in all, this was a great experience. It's not an hotel. It is hybrid B&B with hotel qualities. Enjoy it if you go!

Reviews.Title: “Like staying with friends. A relaxing and charming B&B and host.”
Reviews.Author: Expensivehotelhabit
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fabulous weekend in Amsterdam staying at the Fusion Suites. I agree with the other reviewers about the charming host and attentive service from Alex and the feeling that you're a visitor in a private house. You get a set of keys and just let yourself in and out of the lovely old townhouse at your leisure. We had a room on the 2nd floor with a huge bathroom, with clawfoot bath and L'Occitane toiletries. The rooms are comfortably decorated and quite homely rather than luxurious but all the better for it in my opinion. The best things about the Fusion Suites are the opposite of all the things that can be so irritating in bigger hotels. Yes, there was a free mini-bar which was replaced every day. We arrived at 10am and left at 4pm - Alex was totally flexible about our timings, which was a breath of fresh air. The kitchen breakfast was varied, delicious and freshly prepared whenever you like in the morning - a ring on the big bell in the hall let us know that it was ready. A computer with free internet in your room. If you're looking for minimalist, 5 star luxury then the Fusion Suites are not for you but if you're after a home away from home in this lovely city then the Fusion Suites are for you.

Reviews.Title: “Now we see why the reviews are so great--and agree”
Reviews.Author: Honu_Ohana
Reviews.Content: My husband chose Fusion Suites somewhat randomly, based on the TA rating and good email interactions with Alex. We were a bit skeptical of the uniformly stellar ratings, but the price was right and the location convenient, because we are great walkers and wanted to be able to walk everywhere. As it turned out, we had to come a day early, escaping the February 2010 Blizzard on the East Coast of the USA. We were glad that we could be accommodated at Fusion Suites and when we arrived, we were cordially greeted by Alex, who had alreadz suggested and made dining reservations for us for our stay. We were in Room 1, on the 3rd floor. It is the one with the borwn and gold decor shown in the guest pictures and was just lovely. It was a large room with high ceilings divided via furniture arrangements into bed and sitting areas. Closet and drawer storage was ample. The bathroom was large with a great shower-tub setup. Everything was sparkling clean and well maintained. The minibar fridge was stocked with drinks (beer, wine, juices, sodas) and we also had a complimentary bottle of champagne. Much appreciated. The beer was restocked during our 4 night stay. Importantly for us, the building has a lift, since the stairs are quite steep going down. The double glazed windows and relatively quiet location made for good sleeping conditions. The bed is of the European style, a little firm for our tastes, but confortable enough. There is free wireless connectivity AND a PC in the room for guest use. We found on the last day that the longed-for robes would have been provided on request, so the motto here should be "if you want something, ask!" It is likely available for you, or can be made available readily. Breakfasts were very good and far more than we could ever possibly eat. Alex was an attentive and friendly host (his wife was out of town) and we enjoyed conversations with him. This was the first time we'd stayed in a hosted lodging and had been a bit shy, but our shyness soon dissipated. We walked to all the sights we went to during our stay and find the location extremely convenient. We definitely will choose Fusion Suites (Room 1) for our next visit to Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Fusion Suites-beautiful rooms and first-class hospitality!”
Reviews.Author: TonyInch
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the first leg of our Honeymoon and it was a great place to start off! Fusion Suites has beautiful rooms, the bathroom was pristine with a lovely free-standing bath and we appreciated the refrigerator full of wine and beer. Alex and Sharmilla provide first-class hospitality, service and personal attention. Couldn't recommend a stay here enough to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous anniversary trip highlighted by staying at the Fusion Suites Number40.”
Reviews.Author: dutchgirlNY2
Reviews.Content: Our 1st European trip was taken in April to celebrate a special anniversary and birthday. We started in Amsterdam and upon Trip Advisor's recommendations, chose to stay at Fusion Suites Number40. Every complimentary review describing the attentiveness of the owners Sharmilla and Alex, pale in comparision to the care we received from them during our stay. Yes, our suite was roomy, clean and comfortable with a lovely bathroom to match. We had champagne waiting for us in our room which was decorated with lovely fresh orchids, as others have mentioned. The location was near the museums, best shopping area and within walking distance to tour buses and canal boats. All those things were great but the charm of this small bed and breakfast hotel is truly the owners. Breakfasts were expertly made by Sharmilla and eaten in her lovely, large kitchen where we got to talk over our plans for the day. Alex and Sharmilla's suggestions helped us see the best of Amsterdam and they even made it possible for us to visit the small town where my mother was born. We can never thank them enough for the many kindnesses they extended to us during our visit and we look forward to seeing them again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay for a long time!”
Reviews.Author: SUTANU
Reviews.Content: Our journey had a breakpoint with all BA flights being cancelled from London to Amsterdam. So instead of reaching on 18th, we reached on 19th Dec 09. When we reached we were upgraded to the Grand Suite and were made to feel most comfortable. Our hosts - Alex and Sharmila were right there and took us through the house and amenities available. The daily breakfast was ofcourse the best start to a day. Mostly we felt like we were meeting friends in a place where we had none. The description of Fusion Suites is exactly as described by all reviewers. If you plan to blend in to amsterdam, there is no better place to start than Fusion Suites

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: JadeJamJars
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our trip in Amsterdam staying in the Grand Suite at Fusion Suites. Alex and Sharmila made us feel welcome, our room was tastefully decorated with a very comfortable bed and bathroom. Breakfasts were home made and delicious and the free wireless internet access was very useful. The building was impressive and the location of Fusion Suites just a ten minute walk from the museums and shops etc was ideal!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, unique, and warm home in busy Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: happydoctor
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, had rooms 1 and 2. We were traveling with 3 small children and a grandparent. The rooms are large and beautifully appointed. Alex and Sharmilla take great care in providing a quiet, but luxurious setting. Our arrival was very early, but the room was ready and this was very welcomed after an overnight flight with a 7, 6 and 3 year old child. Alex got us quickly registered and we were able to take a morning nap to get over the jetlag. He kindly recommended restaurants and local bike rental. Breakfast was fresh eggs, pancakes, Dutch cheese, fruit, and ham. Everything was made to order. The beds, linens, and decor are of the highest quality. Even the rollaway beds for the children were very comfortable. We appreciated the refrigerator full of juice for the children and wine and beer for the adults. I would absolutely recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam. I plan on returning one day, too!

Reviews.Title: “Just so long as you're not expecting a luxury hotel, or a suite, but rather a bed-and-breakfast . . .”
Reviews.Author: DaneP
Reviews.Content: I have very mixed feelings about this hotel. On the one hand, itâ€™s really a pleasure to stay in a 19th century building in such a beautiful area. The street and several of the surrounding streets are lined with postcard perfect late 19th century townhouses that are absolutely gorgeous. And if you go in knowing that the high price is something you can accept in order to support such a very small hotel (4 roomsâ€”theyâ€™re not suites by any stretch of the imagination) that is the opposite of a formulaic chain hotel, you probably wonâ€™t be disappointed. But just be very aware that youâ€™re basically staying at a bed-and-breakfast, not a full service hotelâ€”even though youâ€™re paying prices that rival the cost of a Four Seasons hotel in other cities. And the rooms are not suitesâ€”theyâ€™re rooms with high ceilings and adjoining bathroomsâ€”not even the size of most junior suites at other hotels. We stayed in one of the street-facing suites, which are more expensive, and definitely more beautiful than the first-floor â€œclassicâ€� room that I saw when the door was ajar and it was being cleaned.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have picked a better place!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoCA09
Reviews.Content: Would def stay there again! Amazing staff and fresh breakfast every morning. Beautiful rooms and great location!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Oz_2_ROW
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four (kids aged 11 & 8) and we were a little concerned about staying in this type of hotel with kids. However, our experience was just perfect. The room, breakfast, location was great. We left feeling like we had visited friends. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Esther32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Fusion Suites for 7 nights. We had a grand suite, room number 1. It was very comfortable and immaculate. The area was away from downtown but a two minute walk to Leidesplein where you can pick up boat rides, tram connections etc. It was also one block from Vondelpark which is a nice place to kick back and relax. The hosts of this b and b were Sharmila and Alex who were helpful and provided a nice breakfast each morning. There is a computer in each room but we had brought our laptops which worked with the free internet access available. They also have a beautiful courtyard which we were allowed to use as well. I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a home away from home that does not feel like a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, close enough to main attractions and great food”
Reviews.Author: djdebbiedebs
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Small hitch with the amsterdamby website which tried to charge us for a deluxe room when we booked a classic one. The owners responded immediately apologising for the mistake and upon arrival, upgraded us to deluxe without us even needing to ask. Breakfasts were wonderful. Room perfect. Hosts superb. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed and breakfast, excellent location, well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: gregd28
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the long review.. hope it is helpful.. I tried to cover the hotel and a little bit about Amsterdam. If you are debating visiting Amsterdam (no matter how old you are) just go and you won't be disappointed. This was my third trip to Amsterdam.. I've done the partying weekends there when I was in my 20s and this was more of a laid back trip. It is nice to remember everything this time :) Fusion Suites is ranked #1 in Amsterdam on TripAdvisor for good reason. The reviews on this site give an accurate picture of the property and service. Our room (#1) was huge, with a great bathroom and stocked minibar. The entire building is very well maintained, very clean.. the kitchen where you eat breakfast is awesome. The rooms have a very nostalgic feel that you just don't get in many hotels. Fusion Suites is a bed and breakfast and it is very quiet.. but this wasn't a bad thing for us. We never heard any other guests and to the best of my knowledge we never bothered anybody - and we were likely a bit loud when we returned from the cafes and bars at night. There is a small lift for bags and for older people who have problems walking up lots of stairs. You might not find a lift in all B&Bs.. so definitely ask for this when looking at other places. Those tall skinny Amsterdam houses usually have very many steep staircases. This was the first B&B we've stayed at in Europe (we typically prefer nice 4 or 5 star hotels with bars, room service, etc..) and I was definitely a little concerned about it being small and quiet, etc. My girlfriend and I stayed for 4 nights - we are in our early 30s and we do still go out and drink and have fun and stay out late when on holiday so I wasn't sure if this place was for us. However, it turned out better than I could have imagined. That being said, this place is definitely meant for couples, small families, or single business travelers - not for younger people or stag parties looking to tear it up for a weekend in Amsterdam. This would be a good place to stay if you are traveling with another couple, with each getting their own suite. With the wireless internet access, minibar, and excellent breakfast (bigger, better, and faster then you will ever get in a restaurant) all included in the price, the rates are actually very reasonable. The rates seem high at first, but consider how those room service, wireless internet (typically expensive in Europe), breakfast tabs, etc.. add up at a hotel - its nice knowing that the price quoted for the room is the price you pay when you checkout. There is also a computer in each room with internet access that is free to use, so if you didn't bring a laptop there is no need to go to an internet cafe.. this is a very good thing for those who don't like to travel with a laptop. Amsterdam is truly a great city to visit for people of all ages. It seems to me that it has a bad reputation across much of the US.. as many people think Amsterdam is dirty (its not at all) and all about hash bars and hookers. Well, both are indeed there but they are not thrown in your face and easily avoidable. You can't drink in 99% of the coffeeshops (hash bars) any more so people don't typically stay there very long and get wasted. Most people just stop in, buy a joint and a coffee or hot chocolate, smoke the joint and then leave happy and get lost walking around the canals - or go to a nearby cafe for a beer. Its generally normal people on holiday from across Europe and the US stopping in the coffeshops and not as many hippies or younger kids as you'd think. But if the coffeshops aren't your thing, they are easily avoided.. although you should at least stop by one to check it out. As for the prostitutes, they are not all over the city and its not advertised all over like it is in Vegas (where its not even legal). Its legal in Amsterdam and its very controlled and mostly centralized to one area. Admittedly it is pretty crazy walking around the red light district and seeing them all in the windows. Lots of sex shops and sex show theaters down there as well.. but its mostly tourists walking around just to see the area. Its not at all scary - and definitely something you won't see anywhere in the US. I wouldn't want a young female friend walking around down there at night by herself - but this can be said of most cities in the world. In general its not a threatening atmosphere. There always seems to be lots of British guys down there on stag parties having a blast.. pretty funny stuff. All in all its worth checking out in the early evening (or even in the day time if you are timid) just to see the spectacle. But again.. easily avoidable if you don't stay in a hotel in that area. To me Amsterdam is about the canals, flowers, walking around at night looking at all of the lit up bridges, really nice art and antique galleries, and the cafes. If you are a museum person (I am not) there are many and I hear they are some of the best in Europe. Of course there are lots and lots of bikes - you can't comprehend the amount of bikes until you visit - they are everywhere. Amsterdam in general is a very clean city. The people are laid back, most speak English, and most are tall and skinny! Amsterdam is pretty small (at least the parts you'll visit) so you can walk or bike around almost everywhere. The trams are easy to use, but watch out for them as they run on the streets - which is actually very convenient as opposed to the underground subways in London and other cities where it takes 10 minutes to get back to street level. Definitely take a boat ride through the canals, but try to get the smaller open top boats (if its nice out) instead of the large canal buses. The large canal boats might be a little cheaper but they are packed full of tourists and you really can't see out as well. The small open boats are great, you can bring drinks and the driver will tell you all about what you are seeing. Good way to get lots of pictures.. definitely worth the extra money. In fact, if you have lots of money, you can rent out a private canal boat that comes with a driver and drinks/food and cruise the canals - go in the late afternoon/ early evening as its getting dark and bring a sweater. Fusion Suites is very close to Vondel park, and I recommend walking over to the Film Museum in the park (you can see this place from the front of the hotel) and sitting in the cafe up on the large balcony. We never actually went into the museum, just had some nice drinks in the cafe - great view. Its really nice in the park during the day, and a good break from the nearby Leidseplein area which can be very crowded and a bit touristy (certainly not a bad area though). Definitely rent a bike for a day or longer (there is a place very close to the hotel) and ride through the whole park and the museum areas. Then if you feel brave enough ride through the canals.. but start in the park to get comfortable. Check out the Remplantplein area for the cafes and the Jordaan area for walking around the canals and seeing where people actually live. In my opinion the best parts of Amsterdam are the least touristy.. and consequently the least crowded. Taxis can be expensive, they are all very nice Mercedes, so try to negotiate the price upfront before you go anywhere. Sometimes they are worth the money (at night if the lady has on high heels and have a ways to go) other times its better to take a tram or just walk. Thank you Alex and Sharmila for a great stay, we will certainly be back soon. If you ever come to LA for a holiday let us know and we'll have you over for dinner and drinks!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hospitality in lavish surroundings”
Reviews.Author: 3DJs_dad
Reviews.Content: It's all true, don't hesitate if you're looking for a quiet hotel to relax in after the huzzle and buzzle of Amsterdam's many attractions. We stayed here in early July and were most impressed with the level of service and hospitality that Alex and Sharmila provide. It's a unique combination of classic and elegant surroundings, the hotel has 4 suites spread out over 2 floors in a fully restored late 19th century mansion, service and discretion. Our family of 4 stayed here for 2 weeks. Because of our late booking, we had to move suites from time to time and as a result experienced all four, elegantly decorated rooms. The individual suites are all spacious and have a very personal tough. It's very easy to feel right at home. As mentioned by some of the other reviewers, where do you find this abundance of fresh flowers and orchids everywhere you go? In your room, in the bath room, in the breakfast room / reception / entry etc we loved the flowers; then there's the complementary champagne (perfectly timed by the proprietors), complementary red and white wine in your room, mini-bar, pc with wi-fi in every room, large comfortable beds, high thread count bed sheets, original artwork, carefully selected furniture and accessories, l'Occitane toiletries, writing desks, mahogany wardrobes (in the Classic Suites), it goes on and on. We used Fusion Suites as our base to visit family and friends in The Netherlands, as well as show our children some of Amsterdam's great heritage. It's was just great. Alex and Sharmila made this the perfect home away from home for us and we're looking forward to our next stay ... I mean, where do you find a hotel where the management team get up at 6am to say goodbye and help you on your way? Thank you Alex and Sharmila!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic as expected”
Reviews.Author: MataiDubai
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at Fusion Suites. As expected this small hotel was superb. We had the Grand Suite which is comfortable and beautifully decorated, making it a wee home away from home. The previous comments pretty much sum it all up... Sharmila and Alex are the quintessential hosts providing a warm welcome, gorgeous breakfasts, great restaurant recommendations and other local information and above all discretion and privacy. To stay in a wee place like this is what makes internet sites like this one worth their weight in gold....how would we ever find it on our own? We shy away from large hotels these days and Fusion Suites represents everything we look for in a place to stay. Thanks to Alex and Sharmila for running such a fabulous spot!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, quiet mansion with lovely owners!”
Reviews.Author: travelinpair83
Reviews.Content: If you like a beautifully decorated suite on a residential street three blocks from activities, then this is the place for you! We stayed in the grand suite and it was GRAND! The location is great since it is very close to the museums yet everything is in walking distance. Amsterdam is a village with charming canals, interesting architecture, shopping, good food and lots of fun! Have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Gator4290
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at Fusion Suites 40 after a 14 day cruise. There is not much I can add to the detailed descriptions of the suites, amenities, and service already well described in other reviews. I picked Fusion Suites based on the TripAdvisor reviews, but was somewhat concerned, first, with whether the place could really be that good, second, with staying in a four suite facility, and third, with its location, which struck me as perhaps a bit "far away" from central Amsterdam. All of my concerns evaporated within a few hours of check in. The rave reviews are spot on, and, if anything, are probably unable to convey adequately what a wonderful place this is. If you just have to have a gym, bar, restaurant, business center (although you get a personal computer plus wi-fi), or walk out the door and be smack in the middle of the crowds in central Amsterdam, then maybe this four suite facility might not be your cup of tea. Otherwise it is perfect. The location turns out to be a plus. It is in a lovely, tranquil mostly residential area, yet close and convenient to everything. We love to walk and the center of town is a short walk away. Tram stops are even closer, if you do not want to walk, and there are a number of good restaurants and shops really close. It is close to the museum district, and the high end shopping street in that area. But best of all, as so many have noted, is the welcome and assistance provided by Sharmila and Alex. They are a delightful couple, she makes a great breakfast, they provide excellent restaurant and other recomendations, and a warm welcome and the feeling that your hosts are your friends. We were fortunate enough to have dinner with Alex our last night (Sharmila was visiting her monther), and being able just to sit and talk with him over dinner was a highlight of our stay. To conclude, the title of this review says it all. We quickly felt that our suite was our "Home in Amsterdam," and not just a nice hotel. Thank you Alex and Sharmila.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: thegourmandcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Fusion Suites last week. This is by far one of the most incredible hotels we have ever stayed in. As previous reviewers have pointed out, this is a house very near the Vondelpark, with four capacious rooms spread out over three floors. We were in Room 4 which was cozy, comfortable and spacious. It had ample space for storage and a bathroom about half the size of the room, with marble floors, a clawfoot tub and l'Occitane toiletries. The room was decorated beautifully with a very elegant wallpaper behind the bed, a little couch by the huge windows which look out onto a little private garden, and a very comfortable bed. Wireless and minibar access are free and a plasma TV is provided with international channels. Apart from the comfortable amenities, the real charm of this hotel lies with its owners. Alex and Sharmila are wonderful people and ideal hosts. Right after we checked in, we had a knock on our door and there was Alex with a bottle of Champagne! They also left a bottle of wonderful Cabernet Sauvignon in our room on another day, which was much appreciated. They provided us with very apt restaurant recommendations - we ate at De Kas and Marius during our stay, and both were incredible. Sharmila's excellent breakfasts are just the icing on the cake. Every morning we had tasty and healthy egg-white omelettes, organic yogurt, fresh-cut fruit, expertly pulled espressos and Sharmila's signature Grand Marnier mini-pancakes. Fusion Suites is a hotel which comes alive thanks to the exquisite taste, effortless hospitality and relaxed vibe of its owners. We recommend it highly, and cannot wait to return. This is a gem of a hotel and richly deserves its #1 rating.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our Expecations”
Reviews.Author: 5starfanatic
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Fusion Suites in Amsterdam and were not at all disappointed. The property is beautiful and has been decorated very tastefully. The rooms have everything you need including free internet access and a dvd and cd player. The only thing missing was bathrobes but we didn't miss them that much. The free stocked mini bar including a bottle of champagne was a lovely touch although I am quite aware that you pay for this within the room rate. The breakfasts each morning were delicious! All in all a wonderful place and a perfect location (short walk to everywhere in the city). Thank you Sharmila and Alex!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Experiences Ever”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastvoyager
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and stay in fabulous famous hotels. But Fusion suites Number 40 was one of the best experiences we have ever had. I really cannot add anything new to the numerous rave reviews on Tripadvisor. Everything you read is true. Alex and Sharmila are wonderful hosts. Her breakfasts are incredible (please make sure she is going to make those mini-pancakes, I have been thinking about them for weeks now). Our grand suite was wonderful, spacious, gracious and came with a free computer and wine. If you go to Amsterdam, you should not stay anywhere else. Plus, Sharmila really knows her restaurants.
